verses.roman:
kaccid vaḥ kuśalaṁ brahman
rājato yasya hi prajāḥ
sukhaṁ vasanti viṣaye
pālyamānāḥ sa me priyaḥ

synonyms: kaccit—whether; vaḥ—your; kuśalam—well-being; brahman—O brāhmaṇa; rājataḥ—from the King; yasya—whose; hi—indeed; prajāḥ—subjects; sukham—happily; vasanti—reside; viṣaye—in the state; pālyamānāḥ—being protected; saḥ—he; me—to Me; priyaḥ—dear.
translation: O brāhmaṇa, is your King attending to your welfare? Indeed, that king in whose country the citizens are happy and protected is very dear to Me.
